description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8sh5r","text":"This protocol describes two methods for determining the amount of vitamin B12 present in the spent medium and cell lysate of algae cultures. The first method is a bioassay, adapted from Mok, Hallberg, \u0026 Taga (2022), which estimates the B12 concentration in solution from the growth of a B12-requiring Escherichia coli mutant. The second method uses the direct detection of cobalt via Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (ICP-MS/MS) as a proxy for vitamin B12. We describe the preparation of spent medium and cell extract fractions from the chlorophyte alga Chlamydomonas reinhardtii for each method, preparation of standard cyanocobalamin solutions, and the correlation between cobalt and cyanocobalamin in algal cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":75,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":237,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":288,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":465,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":301,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":566,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dove","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ab7d","text":"We thank Michi Taga and Alison Smith for their guidance in optimizing the bioassay for C. reinhardtii.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":87,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtkrd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agbhj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4orbr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5iops","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2cnl5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Kenny C. Mok, Zachary F. Hallberg, Michiko E. Taga","can_edit":1,"date":"1645473821","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1016/bs.mie.2021.11.023","guid":"90B667B0935111EC93F7A57DE19D7897","id":1579,"journal":"Methods in Enzymology","protocol_id":null,"title":"Purification and detection of vitamin B12 analogs"}},"1":{"type":"citation","mutability":"","data":{"authors":"Kirmiz N, Galindo K, Cross KL, Luna E, Rhoades N, Podar M, Flores GE","can_edit":1,"date":"1579564800","doi":"https://doi.org/pii:e02117-19.10.1128/AEM.02117-19","guid":"A5A6AF40847411ECB9BE0FE31F48DC8E","id":1518,"journal":"Applied and environmental microbiology","protocol_id":"0","title":"Comparative Genomics Guides Elucidation of Vitamin B12 Biosynthesis in Novel Human-Associated Akkermansia Strains."}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6o486","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7pgr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"adm4r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":11,"offset":31,"style":"italic"},{"length":4,"offset":43,"style":"italic"},{"length":5,"offset":49,"style":"italic"},{"length":4,"offset":59,"style":"italic"},{"length":5,"offset":64,"style":"italic"},{"length":8,"offset":207,"style":"italic"},{"length":5,"offset":216,"style":"italic"},{"length":4,"offset":303,"style":"italic"},{"length":5,"offset":308,"style":"italic"},{"length":5,"offset":402,"style":"italic"},{"length":4,"offset":412,"style":"italic"},{"length":4,"offset":417,"style":"italic"},{"length":3,"offset":267,"style":"sub"},{"length":2,"offset":495,"style":"sub"},{"length":2,"offset":553,"style":"sub"}],"key":"b15er","text":"This protocol makes use of the Escherichia coli Î”metE and Î”metEÎ”metH mutant strains. MetE is the cobalamin-independent homocysteine transmethylase, and MetH is a cobalamin-dependent methionine synthase. The E. coli Î”metE strain requires either methionine or vitamin B12 supplementation for growth. The Î”metEÎ”metH strain can only grow when provided methionine. Samples of interest are provided to both Î”metE and Î”metEÎ”metH, and the growth of each is compared to that supported by either vitamin B12 standards or methionine standards, respectively. Thus B12 concentration in a solution can be measured and can be distinguished from methionine. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h6m7","text":"Prepare cell culture fractions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0bm7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fgj1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":25,"offset":115,"style":"italic"},{"length":18,"offset":231,"style":"italic"},{"length":22,"offset":254,"style":"italic"}],"key":"6td4m","text":"The following procedure is effective for the preparation of spent medium and cell lysate from both the chlorophyte Chlamydomonas reinhardtii (both cell wall containing and cell wall reduced strains) as well as the Î±-proteobacteria Mesorhizobium loti and Sinorhizobium meliloti when grown in minimal media. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ounl","text":"Collect    culture into a 2 ml screw-cap tube. If snap-cap tubes are used, secure lids with a special tube rack or a weight while boiling.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

This is especially important for motile strains.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0fq2","text":"Prepare a series of CNCbl standards up to 10X the target concentration in purified water (Millipore) by serial dilution. Aliquot at least   of each standard into screw-cap tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":138,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"64ejv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5lv9d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67i3d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"795iq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"3D3D2160849611ECA6A5D9333AE6C10E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b8bpp","text":"We have found serial dilutions to the following concentrations produces a useful range of 10X CNCbl standards: 900, 600, 400, 267, 178, 119, 79, 53, 35, 23 ng/L.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f2p7n","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":2,"offset":140,"style":"sub"},{"length":7,"offset":177,"style":"italic"}],"key":"49onq","text":"Standards can also be prepared in minimal media that were used for test samples if desired. However, this should not impact results, since B12 will be the limiting nutrient for E. coli growth during the bioassay.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bggou","text":"Prepare a series of   methionine standards to 10X the target concentration in milliQ H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":86,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bg12t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bnteb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35u8b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"36F46570849611ECA6A5D9333AE6C10E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fdedp","text":"We have found serial dilutions of the following concentrations produces a useful range of 10X methionine standards: 300, 150, 75, 38, 19 mg/L","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2aq6r","text":"Carefully overlay the pellet with   trace metal grade nitric acid (we use Fischer Chemical Trace Metal Grade Nitric Acid, Catalogue Number A509-P212).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"58ghg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2u5m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cn43u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"286","error":false,"guid":"B64EC20086FF11EC8F88F5EA2A714494","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"h80f","text":"Take care to leave the compacted pellet undisturbed, as any cell material dissolving from the pellet will not be digested properly.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
